title: Truffle instantiates duplicate providers after every contract in a deployment is mined, linear increase in API calls per contract deployed
body:
- [ ] I've [opened a support ticket](https://trufflesuite.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) before filing this issue.

---------------------------

## Issue

For every contract deployed by truffle, a new provider appears to be instantiated. This is a memory leak but it all results in a chattier application with unnecessary calls the the JSON RPC endpoint. 

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new truffle project (MetaCoin works)
2. Pull down `ganache` (not required but helps illustrate the point)
3. Change 
`logging-options.ts L102  log: config.quiet ? () => {} : console.count`
4. In your migrations, Copy/Paste the deploy line so you are deploying multiple times:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6285466/163443497-7ad985fa-6a30-4a6b-a612-d4b2f9608fce.png)
5. Start a local ganache from cli with 8s block mining interval
6. define and deploy to the local ganache network

Tested against truffle stable and the `provider-changes` branch, confirmed on both. Logged output:

Logs on stable: https://gist.github.com/tenthirtyone/e9e30ec9d6a5520e7ed2d91a15908aee
Logs on provider-change: https://gist.github.com/tenthirtyone/a0d1d232984d4b8662012edda3d3bdec

## Expected Behavior

The number of JSON RPC endpoint calls between contract deploys should be consistent. 

## Actual Results

JSON RPC calls increase linearly for each contract deployed. 

Truffle Stable RPC call growth per contract deployed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6285466/163443893-4914466b-fde5-402f-a016-2088363a2e31.png)

`provider-changes` RPC call growth per contract deployed:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6285466/163443935-7957d997-0f43-4ab5-b85d-61fc44232a8e.png)

I measured the number of `eth_getBlockByNumber` calls made between every contract deployment

E.g.
RPC calls made between contract 1 & contract 2 and a constant block mine interval of 8s: 45
RPC calls made between contract 2 & contract 3 and a constant block mine interval of 8s: 70
RPC calls made between contract 3 & contract 4 and...: 94

The change is consistently at 24.

This contributes to why users experience the polling timeout and soft caps us on the number of contracts we can deploy per migration file. I have not run this test against multiple migration files. 

## Environment

* Operating System: UBUNTU
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.5.3
* node version (`node --version`): 12.22.7
* npm version (`npm --version`):
